longevityPassport.title: Longevity Passport
longevityPassport.description:
A comprehensive mobile and web platform for a premium preventative medicine clinic, that digitizes the entire patient lifecycle — from secure file transfer to daily lifestyle tracking.

Designed to turn complex medical data into actionable, easy-to-understand insights.

sevenSprings.title: Seven Springs Website
sevenSprings.description:
A responsive web and booking platform for a luxury wellness startup, designed to translate an evolving brand vision into a structured digital product.

Focused on rapid prototyping to align stakeholders and protect development resources during a volatile 0-to-1 launch.

orIntegration.title: O.R. Integration System
orIntegration.description:
A mission-critical interface for surgical environments, reverse-engineered from a legacy system with zero existing documentation.

Designed to reduce cognitive load for technicians by transforming complex configuration data into an error-proof, modern admin panel.

psychologist.title: My background
psychologist.paragraph1_part1: I hold a dual degree in
psychologist.paragraph1_part2: , a combination that shapes every decision I make as a designer. While the Computer Science background helps me speak the language of developers (and respect their constraints), my Psychology background is the lens through which I view the user.
psychologist.paragraph2: I don't just see "users" or "traffic." I see humans with limited working memory, specific cognitive biases, and emotional needs.

compass.title: From chaos to compass
compass.paragraph1: My design philosophy is rooted in my academic thesis: "From chaos to compass - the architecture of meaning: A case study of the research and design process for a mobile application supporting the pursuit of a satisfying life in alignment with personal values." In it, I explored how digital tools can guide people through the noise of daily life toward what actually matters.
compass.paragraph2_part1: I have carried this philosophy into my professional career. Whether I am untangling a complex legacy system for a hospital or building a wellness ecosystem from scratch, my goal is always the same:
compass.paragraph2_goal: Reduce the chaos. Provide a clear path.

healthtech.title: Why healthTech?
healthtech.paragraph: I am deeply invested in personal well-being and the mechanics of a satisfactory life. I believe technology has a responsibility to support human health, not drain it. This is why I specialize in HealthTech—building tools that respect the user's time, protect their data, and ultimately help them live better, longer lives.
